other_tests.changes_over_time: Biopsy obtained six months after bone marrow transplantation showed normal mucosa.

other_tests.findings: Extensive subacute eczematous lesions with lichenification noted.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Mild eczematous lesions were observed six months after transplantation and improved rapidly with corticosteroid cream.

other_tests.findings: Transplantation led to a transient clinical response and subsequent improvement in symptoms.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Diarrhea improved three days before transplantation; stools were normal one month after transplantation, with a sustained remission for over two years.

other_tests.findings: High serum titers of antibodies against glutamic acid decarboxylase (GAD65) and pancreatic islets detected.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Raised antibodies against pancreatic islets and GAD65 were no longer detected by day 180 after bone marrow transplantation.

other_tests.findings: 95 percent of white cells were of the female XX genotype.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Mixed chimerism observed at 16 and 23 months after transplantation.
